instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
As soon as I plug in the charger it goes green and turns orange and won't start, with or without the battery connected.
  Apparently it doesn't have any charred resistors.
  PPBUS_G3H = 12.6V

ISL6259 pins:

1 - 16.5v
12 - 3.3v
14 - 3v

The others I will measure tomorrow.

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
U7100 works.
Good enough to check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.

Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS and AVREF_SMC?

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
3V3_S5/SUS and AVREF_SMC are present
17/18 =  3.5 Ohms
27/28 = 20 Ohms

The funny thing is that when I individually measure the resistors R7151 and R7152 they present their resistance correctly.
Am I doing something wrong?

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
The funny thing is that when I individually measure the resistors R7151 and R7152 they present their resistance correctly.
  Am I doing something wrong?

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
The values reported are correct.

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message: Yes, I have 3.42V and as soon as I activate the power PM_PWRBTN_L falls too!

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message: Ok, check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L (at same time).

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
I do not have the pulse PM_SLP_S4_L , is with 0V and when I press the power it stays the same.
 I don’t have a short on that line.

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
Seems to have a PCH related problem.

Post PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PM_BATLOW_L, PM_RSMRST_L and the 4 PCH's RTC signals.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
PCH_DSWVRMEN =  3.2v
PM_DSW_PWRGD = 3.4V
PM_BATLOW_L = 0.03V ( R1410 is with 10k correctly )
PM_RSMRST_L = 3.3V

RTC_RESET_L =  3.3v
PCH_SRTCRST_L  = 3.3v
PCH_INTRUDER_L = 3.0V
PCH_INTVRMEN =  3.2v

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
"PM_BATLOW_L = 0.03V"
Are you using ORIGINAL 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger?

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
I’m using a parallel charger from the client itself, but I tried an original 45W and now I’m using it straight from the asymmetric source and all point to the same result of 0.3V
  On the other side of the resistance I have the PP3V3_S5 but passes only 0.3V but the resistance is with its normal value of 10K, is some PCH instruction and or SMC informing that the battery is low!
  Can this be caused by corrupted BIOS?

[TD][/TD]

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message: One thing I noticed, is that when plugging the charger, the resistance of the side of PM_BATLOW_L goes at 200 Ohms and when I shoot the charger, back to 0 Ohms. I also noticed that there is a Q3000 reference transitor that is connected to this line, maybe it may be causing this problem, i’m not very convinced, but I’m already desperate, so...

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
"Are you using ORIGINAL [U][B]60/85W[/B][/U] Magsafe 2 charger?
----------------------
I tried an original [U][B]45W[/B][/U]"
Can you test with original [U][B]60[/B][/U], or [U][B]85W[/B][/U] Magsafe 2 charger???


"I’m using it straight from the asymmetric source"
Using 60/85W Magsafe 2 cable for sure???


"when plugging the charger, the resistance of the side of PM_BATLOW_L goes at 200 Ohms"
STOP checking in diode mode, or ohm scale on powered board!!!

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
I don't have an original 60 or 85W charger, it will take a while to arrive if I order 1 for testing. From the tests I did on other macbooks, with the asymmetric font, I didn't have similar problems, I don't think it's the font, but I'll follow your instructions!
  Is there anything else I can check until the charger arrives?

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
The board should turn on with 45W charger if battery is connected and holds some charge.
It may also turn on in SMC bypass mode.

PCH requires high level on PM_BATLOW_L to start power on sequence in normal mode.

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message: Do you think that while I wait for the load, I can do something like, reset the BIOS, or would it be a waste of time?

threads.title: Apple Macbook Pro Retina 13/ MB: 820-4924-A / The green LED lights up and then goes to orange and does not turn on
threads.message:
I suggested you to try SMC bypass.

Is the battery charging?
